author: Ella Jay
title: Mike Santana Calls Homicide A Mentor, A ‘Forefather’ Of The Independent Wrestling Movement
text:
Mike Santana praises Homicide for his contributions to the pro wrestling scene.
On Thursday, Mike Santana will face JDC (Johnny “Dango” Curtis) in a Texas Death Match on TNA iMPACT. Recently, Santana spoke with WrestleZone Managing Editor Bill Pritchard about a man who is no stranger to death matches, and someone he considers to be a great mentor — that being Homicide.
Much like Santana, Homicide has spent plenty of time in TNA Wrestling. Beyond that, though, Homicide has inspired a generation of wrestlers on the independent professional circuit, especially those in New York City.
“Homicide has been a mentor for me since I was like 18, 19 years old,” Santana said. “He’s known me since I was a little kid. Guys like him and [Amazing] Red, when they start coming out and breaking out back in 2000, 2001, 2002, those guys pretty much created what you see today as far as the whole independent movement. Those guys for me are like the forefathers of that indie style and that whole generation. They’ve both, especially Homicide, he’s had such a huge impact on so many guys in wrestling.”
“He’s worked with everyone you could imagine, from the CM Punks to the Samoa Joes to American Dragon [Bryan Danielson]. He’s had classics with all of them. I even say he doesn’t get the credit that he deserves because he’s had such a huge impact on so many guys. He’s been responsible for so many guys breaking into the business and being trained by him. He’s a special individual, and he was always such a huge representative for the New York City independent movement.”
EXCLUSIVE: @Santana_Proud wants @DirtyDangoCurty in a Texas Death Match!?!?!? pic.twitter.com/WZIbJuJ9vg
— TNA Wrestling (@ThisIsTNA) September 14, 2024 New York City Ties Also growing up in New York City, Santana recalled watching VHS tapes of Homicide and his “Doghouse” wrestling school comrades. Years later, Santana finds himself under the tutelage of Homicide, so much so that Homicide has passed the proverbial torch and cemented Santana as a “new head” of New York City.
“His whole story is very interesting,” Santana added. “[Homicide] literally started wrestling. He went to wrestling school maybe the day after he came out of jail, like something crazy. He gets off the bus from Rikers Island, he sees a flyer, and he starts wrestling school. For me, he was the first guy in wrestling that taught me that it doesn’t matter where you come from, how you grew up, what you’ve been through, you can make something of yourself. We both come from similar backgrounds as far as being born and raised in the Projects in New York City and growing up on the street and stuff like that.”
RELATED: Mike Santana Feels Blessed, Is Hitting On All Cylinders Since Return From Injury

author: Jordi Gil
title: Los campeones arrancan a buen ritmo, aunque sin gol en Belgrado
text: Los campeones arrancan a buen ritmo, aunque sin gol en Belgrado La selección española avasalló a Serbia en el segundo tiempo, pero las buenas jugadas, sobre todo de Lamine Yamal, no recibieron premio España arrancó con un punto en Belgrado en el estreno de la nueva edición de la UEFA Nations League. El equipo dejó otra vez una impresión muy positiva, aunque en esta ocasión no tuvo la magia de acertar ante la meta contraria para llevarse la merecida victoria De la Fuente se decantó por Dani Olmo en la media punta y Pedri se quedó en el banquillo. [Lamine, recuperado de su golpe, y Nico Williams tuvieron en esta ocasión a Ayoze como referencia](/deportes/2024/09/04/fuente-lamine-golpe-jugar-serbia-107757951.html) ofensiva con la baja de Morata. El otro cambio obligado por sanción y cantado fue el de Zubimendi por Rodri. Serbia salió con su habitual sistema de tres centrales y con una brutal pitada al técnico Dragan Stojkovic de una afición aún dolida por la tempranera eliminación en la Eurocopa. La media entrada que se registró en el 'Pequeño Marakaná' fue la mejor muestra del desencanto con la selección. Los precedentes, sin embargo, no son un barómetro preciso en el inicio de una nueva temporada y ni el campeón de Europa podía confiarse ni los serbios tirar la toalla antes de empezar. Aunque España salió dominando y controlando el balón, Serbia pudo marcar nada más empezar en un veloz contragolpe desbaratado en última instancia por Laporte y un lanzamiento desviado encima de la portería de David Raya. La Roja debía imponer su estilo, aunque vio pronto que tampoco debía desprotegerse. Pese a ello, Carvajal sufría por la derecha y Jovic dispuso de la segunda ocasión local. Jovic perdona la más clara La Roja debía mejorar su juego plano ofensivo y tratar de ser más vertical. Lamine Yamal y Nico Williams eran las válvulas de escape frente a un rival que tenía claro su plan: defender muy juntos y salir a la contra. Con los extremos más participativos y un Dani Olmo omnipresente llegó la primera oportunidad española con una volea alta de Carvajal. Lamine y Nico se activaron y Serbia empezó a sufrir. Sus disparos empezaron a llegar y meter el miedo en el cuerpo aún más a sus rivales. Entre el azulgrana y Olmo fabricaron una jugada preciosa con remate final de Ayoze detenido por Rajkovic. La réplica fue inmediata con Jovic y Le Normand rompiendo el fuera de juego, fallando de forma increíble solo ante Raya. El partido se animó y Fabián cruzó la pelota en medio de la locura. El medio tiempo sirvió para calmar los ánimos a un partido muy disputado, con cinco amarillas solo en 45 minutos. Sin tregua El alto ritmo continuó en el segundo tiempo con una falta lanzada por Ilic al lateral de la red. Serbia se lo creía y veía que cada vez que aceleraba creaba peligro. De la Fuente contestó con cambios de calidad situando a Grimaldo y Oyarzabal. Las sustituciones dieron aire a España para frenar los arreones balcánicos. Grimaldo dejó su sella que obligó a volar a Rajkovic, con rechace posterior para Lamine, quien acarició el gol con su rosca. España se sentía por fin superior al rival y se veía con más opciones de ganar. El ex portero del Mallorca se volvió a lucir frente al blaugrana y Fabián perdonó en el área pequeña tras una recuperación del de Rocafonda. De la Fuente quería ganar y situó a Pedri para los últimos minutos. El equipo estaba volcado y solo faltaba tener mayor claridad en el área contraria. Con el juego solo en campo serbio, el de la rioja subió su apuesta con dos hombres de área como Joselu y Ferran. El ex madridista pudo ser víctima de un penalti nada más entrar. Los últimos balones centrados al área no tuvieron recompensa y España se tuvo que conformar con un punto que puede mejorar si el domingo gana en Suiza. Ficha técnica Serbia: Rajkovic, Erakovic (Simic, 45'), Milenkovic, Pavlovic, Nedejkovic, Ilic (Mitrovic, 85'), Lukic, Birmancevic, Samardzic (Grujic, 74'), Zivkovic (Belic, 63') y Jovic (Ratkov, 74') España: Raya, Carvajal, Le Normand, Laporte, Cucurella (Grimaldo, 57'), Zubimendi, Fabián (Pedri, 77'), Lamine Yamal, Olmo (Ferran Torres, 81'), Nico Williams (Joselu, 81') y Ayoze (Oyarzabal, 57') Árbitro: Serdar Gözübüyük. TA: Erakovic (5'), Birmancevic (44'), Belic (70') / Ayoze (22'), Carvajal (27'), Lamine (41'), Laporte (46'), Le Normand (59'), Olmo (67'), De la Fuente (85') Estadio: Rajko Mitić, 30.000 espectadores author: Rocky Neufeld
title: Current and former Canora Supers to receive special honour
text: CANORA - This Saturday, Sept, 7, the 1998 Yorkton Expos 18U baseball will be inducted into the Yorkton Sports Hall of Fame. “It is an honour years in the making, but will be a great feeling to be recognized,” said Greg Andreychuk, current Canora Supers player/manager and member of the 1998 Expos. “Several of the players will be at the award ceremony, which will be a feather in the cap for a great accomplishment.” In addition to Andreychuk, other current and former Supers who were members of the Expos include: Darcy Blommaert, Travis Mentanko, Graham Lamb, Mike Chillog, Travis Fogg, Phil Sobkow, Jeff Wizniak, and Mark Newans. In 1998, the Expos won Midget (18U) AAA Provincial Championship and went on to earn bronze medals at Nationals. A post at the Canora Supers Facebook stated, “Congratulations guys, it's well deserved!” The Expos original roster had 12 players, competing in two leagues: South Saskatchewan (18U) Midget AAA Baseball League, and the Southeast Senior Baseball League. In total, the team played in 64 games throughout the season, with an impressive record of 46 wins, 16 losses and 2 ties. Being a part of the team required extreme commitment and dedication, according to Andreychuk. “This team enjoyed playing ball, and thrived on competing against the best competition possible. Most teams would not commit to playing in more than one league, but the Expos teams routinely did this throughout the ’90s.” Led by coaches Kash Andreychuk, Vern Neal, and John Zeeben, the number one rule for the team was, “You have to have fun.” “If you weren’t enjoying yourself than you were on the wrong team,” said Andreychuk. “The team did not get down if an error was made, or if a call didn’t go their way. With a potent lineup, good pitching and a solid defence, the group knew they could overcome adversity. On several occassions the Expos found themselves trailing games by five or more runs, only to make a comeback and win.” Many of the Expos players were among the league leaders in hitting and pitching. Travis Mentanko was one of the most respected power hitters, leading the 18U league in home runs and runs batted in. Graham Lamb and Mike Chillog were among the top five in batting average and stolen bases, while Greg Andreychuk was also among the league leaders in stolen bases. Darcy Blommaert and Travis Fogg were in the top five in pitching wins, strikeouts and earned run average. In 1999, several of the Expos players graduated from the 18U ranks, and needed a place to play. These players were: Andreychuk, Blommaert, Chillog, Lamb, Mentanko, and Wizniak. Yorkton had one senior baseball team at the time, the Yorkton Black Sox, but they had a full roster with no openings. Lamb had been playing Junior B hockey in Canora with the Cobras, so the rest of the guys ended up joining him and the Supers. “It was a tremendous season,” recalled Andreychuk, “with the new recruits and some seasoned vets such as player/coach Terry Dennis, Aaron Chicilo, Mike Weisgerber, Jeff Bahrey and Todd Schaefer placing first in the regular season and also taking home the league championship with a 3-0 series win over the Madge Lake Marlins.” To this day, Andreychuk, Blommaert, and Mentanko still suit up for the Supers. Chillog had played with the Supers until 2007 before moving to Regina, where he still plays to this day with the Regina Capitals in the Qu’Appelle Valley Baseball League. He even played a game with the Supers in 2024 in Melville against the Parkland Pirates when the team was short players. Phil Sobkow was picked up for Provincials and Nationals by the Expos, and played several years for the Supers from 2014 to 2022. Mark Newans also played on the Expos, and joined the Supers down the road, winning the Senior League title in 2008. “Not many people play senior baseball into their mid 40s, but for some there is just not much else to do during the summer months, and baseball is a way of life,” concluded Andreychuk. Don't count on social media to deliver your local news to you. Keep your news a touch away by bookmarking Canora Courier's homepage at [this link]. Bookmark SASKTODAY.ca, Saskatchewan's home page, at [this link].

author: 央视
title: 南方降雨进入核心影响时段 华北东北多地凉意加重|华北_新浪财经_新浪网
text:
今明天（5月8日至9日），中东部将现大范围降雨，南方部分地区雨势较强，或遭遇大暴雨侵袭并伴有强对流天气，当地需警惕山体滑坡、泥石流等次生灾害，公众需关注预警预报信息，途经积水路段尽量绕行。同时，华北周边也可能有明显降水，受阴雨影响，气温偏低，凉意加重，需注意添衣防着凉。
中东部降雨范围扩大
南方降雨进入核心时段
昨天，南方新一轮降雨过程已经展开影响。监测显示，昨天8时至今天6时，重庆东部、湖北西南部、湖南西北部、广西东北部、广东中西部及台湾岛北部等地部分地区出现大到暴雨，重庆彭水、湖北恩施、湖南张家界、广东肇庆和江门等局地大暴雨。
今天，南方降雨进入核心影响时段，范围扩大，强度增强。同时，北方多地降雨发展增多。中央气象台预计，江淮大部、江汉东部、江南西南部和中东部、华南北部以及华北东北部等地部分地区有大到暴雨，其中，安徽西南部、湖北东部、江西东北部、浙江西部、广西北部等地部分地区有大暴雨，上述部分地区伴有短时强降水，局地有雷暴大风或冰雹等强对流天气。
明天，华北大部、黄淮东部、江南南部、华南等地部分地区有中到大雨，其中，河北中部、北京西南部、广西东北部、广东西北部等地部分地区有暴雨。
后天，华南大部、云南东部、新疆伊犁河谷、台湾岛等地部分地区有中到大雨，其中，广西东南部、广东西南部、海南岛中部等地部分地区有暴雨。
今明两天，中东部将迎大范围降雨过程，其中今天江南局地雨势较强，安徽、湖北、江西、浙江、广西等地部分地区将有大暴雨，降水量将超过100毫米，需警惕各类次生灾害。同时，上述部分地区还伴有强对流天气，公众需关注预警预报信息，注意出行安全。同时，华北周边也可能出现明显降水，还伴有雷电天气，外出也需带好雨具。
北方多地将现大风沙尘
华北东北凉意加重
受冷空气影响，今明天，北方多地还可能出现大风沙尘天气，西北地区东部、内蒙古、华北部分地区有4至6级风，内蒙古西部、新疆南疆等地部分地区伴有沙尘天气。
在阴雨和冷空气的双重打压下，华北、东北多地气温偏低，尤其是明天，东北最高气温在15℃上下，华北多地在20℃上下，气温水平较同期明显偏低。
不过，后天随着阴雨范围收缩，中东部大部将重启晴热升温模式。11日至13日，东北、华北多地气温将创今年来新高。大城市中，石家庄9日的最高气温将只有21℃，但12日可能会冲上36℃，高温再现，前后冷暖差异较大，公众需密切关注气温变化，及时增减衣物，谨防感冒。
（来源：中国天气网）

author: Shannon Geisen
title: CHI St. Joseph’s Health opens new general surgery clinic
text: Dr. Megan Gilmore performs both general and bariatric surgeries. CHI St. Joseph’s Health recently expanded its surgical services in Park Rapids. Sonja Day, communication/marketing manager for the hospital, explained that an “ICU wing has been converted to our own general surgery clinic, and Dr. Megan Gilmore is our very first surgeon.” ADVERTISEMENT Gilmore performs both general surgery – for example, colonoscopies, appendectomies, hernia, reflux or gallbladder surgeries – and bariatric surgeries. Previously, CHI St. Joseph’s Health contracted surgeons with other organizations, “but now we employ our own surgeon as well as the anesthesiologists.” This is particularly beneficial, she added, since there’s an older population in Hubbard County and they may not have transportation to another town. An open house was held for hospital employees on Wednesday, Nov. 6. The remodeled wing has five consultation rooms and a nurses’ station. “It’s great to have her do different kinds of surgeries for the community. It’s so exciting,” Day said. “We have our primary care clinic downstairs, so if they need a referral to a surgery, they can have it done here.” Gilmore worked for Mayo Clinic Health System in Mankato for 12 years prior to moving to Park Rapids. Her first day was Oct. 31. While in Mankato, she built up the clinic’s minimally invasive surgery and bariatrics programs. “It’s what I enjoy doing – building practices,” Gilmore said. “Most of the surgeries I do are minimally invasive, laparoscopic or robotic.” ADVERTISEMENT Gilmore noted weight loss surgery has been available at the hospital since 2001. “If someone has had surgery, I’m happy to see them and do their long-term followup, because those are patients we typically see for life.” For more information, call 218-616-3800. ADVERTISEMENT

author: ABEL Marie-Louise
title: Marie-Louise ABEL - Avis d'obsèques et remerciements du 29/12/2023 - L'indépendant
text: Avis d'obsèques et remerciements de Madame Marie-Louise ABEL Toulouges (66) Première publication le 29 décembre 2023 7 consultations Avis d'obsèques et remerciements Toulouges. Ses enfants, M. et Mme ABEL Noël et Angèle ; ses petits-enfants, M. et Mme ABEL Olivier et Christine, M. et Mme ABEL Eric et Béatrice ; ses arrière-petits-enfants, Quentin, Diego, Elodie, Martin et Rémi ; les familles ABEL, VERGES, TROÑO, MARTINEZ, parents et alliés ont la tristesse de vous faire part du décès de Madame Marie-Louise ABEL née BOLFA dite "Mimi" enlevée à leur affection à l'âge de 96 ans. Les obsèques civiles auront lieu le vendredi 29 décembre 2023, à 14 heures au cimetière Père Pinya de Toulouges. Le cortège funéraire partira du domicile. Mimi repose à son domicile, 17 rue des Troubadours à Toulouges. La famille remercie le Dr Gabaude, le cabinet de soins infirmiers Kévin, Gwenaëlle, Vanessa, et Muriel, le CCAS de Toulouges, Aimée, Patricia la kiné, pour leur gentillesse et leur dévouement, ainsi que toutes les personnes, présentes ou pas, qui prendront part à sa peine. PF & MARBRERIE MASSUET Chambre funéraire THUIR Tél. 04.68.53.00.00. Hommages et messages à Marie-Louise ABEL Aucun hommage ou message n'a été déposé à ce jour.

author: Citi Newsroom
title: Akufo-Addo extends Easter greetings to Ghanaians, calls for prayer and safety
text:
President Nana Addo Dankwa Akufo-Addo, along with his wife Rebecca, family, and on behalf of the government, has extended Easter greetings to all Ghanaians.
The president said that he hopes the Easter celebration will bestow healing upon the nation and purify it from all wrongdoings.
President Akufo-Addo in his address noted that the celebration of the Crucifixion and Resurrection of Jesus Christ should usher in a new season characterised by faith, hope, growth, prosperity, reconciliation, and sacrifice for everyone in Ghana and around the world.
He also emphasised the need for safety throughout the holiday season. He appealed to all to exercise caution while driving and to continuously hold the nation in their prayers.
President Akufo-Addo further urged Ghanaians to take part in the various Easter activities, such as conventions, social gatherings, picnics, and the time-honoured Kwahu Easter celebrations, all while adhering to established safety measures.
